business.headline: Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $40 million to 2 women in talc powder caseThe verdict comes as the company faces tens of thousands of similar lawsuits nationwide and after its latest attempt to resolve the litigation through bankruptcy was rejected by US courts.

How is young India really spending money? Hint: It's not gadgets and clothesYoung Indians' spending habits are shifting quickly, and it's no longer about gadgets or new outfits. Here's a closer look at where their money is actually going.

Cabinet clears 100% FDI in insurance: What the new bill means for the sectorThe government says the changes are designed to offer stronger protection to policyholders and bring more players into the market. This could lead to better products, faster claim settlements, and improved customer service.

Aroon Purie rings NSE bell, says it's for next chapter of India, India Today GroupIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie on Friday rang the closing bell at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) to mark the Group's 50-year journey and said it was for the next chapter of India and the India Today Group.

NSE bell we ring today is for next chapter of India, India Today Group: Aroon PurieThe moment symbolised both a milestone for the media group and a nod to India's financial markets, which have grown alongside the Group's own evolution since 1975.

Video: NSE felicitates India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie on 50-year milestoneNational Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Ashish Kumar Chauhan on Friday felicitated India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie as the Group completed 50 years at a ceremony in Mumbai.

Retail inflation rises to 0.71% in November from 0.25% in OctoberFood inflation remained in deflation for the sixth straight month, but the pace of decline narrowed sharply. The Consumer Food Price Index showed a contraction of 3.91% in November, compared to a much steeper 5.02% fall in October.

Silver prices cross Rs 2 lakh milestone: Is there more upside left?Silver has been on a strong upward streak over the past month, supported by a softer US dollar, falling global interest rates and renewed buying in industrial commodities.
Video: India Today Chairman Aroon Purie rings NSE bell to mark ITG's 50 yearsIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie rang the NSE bell on Friday to mark the Group's 50 years.
Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%

India–US trade deal talks move forward, but Delhi refuses to open agriculture marketIndia has refused to allow American agricultural products into the Indian market. India believes that permitting US farm goods would increase competitive pressure on domestic farmers and reduce their income.

Unclaimed wealth is rising in India. How silence around money is costing familiesA growing number of Indian families are learning that wealth without communication can turn into confusion, conflict and costly mistakes. The solution begins long before any will is written.

From TDS gaps to bank errors: Why your ITR refund is delayed and what to do nowSeveral taxpayers in India have not received their income tax refunds for the assessment year 2025-26, with delays attributed to verification errors and compliance checks.

Inside the world of India's ultra-rich: What they buy, how they liveHow are India's wealthiest families redefining luxury today, and what do their latest spending habits reveal about their lifestyles? Let's have a look.

Keys to new homes first, then redevelopment begins: Pranav Adani on Dharavi planPranav Adani said that the Dharavi project is finally progressing with a concrete plan to build around 2 lakh new homes, ensuring residents are moved into these units before any demolition or redevelopment of old structures begins.

NPS expands investment options: Now gold, silver ETFs and Nifty 250 picks allowedIndia's pension regulator issues updated unified investment rules for pension schemes, introducing clearer limits and a wider range of asset classes.

New labour codes: No, your take-home salary isn't reducing. Here's the mathFears of reduced take-home salaries have surged since the new labour codes were notified, but a closer look at the PF calculation shows the impact may not be what many employees expect.

Hindustan Zinc share price jumps over 3%: Why is the stock rising today?Hindustan Zinc's share price advanced over 3% in Friday trading, continuing its upward momentum amid rising silver prices and sector-wide gains in metals stocks.

Sensex jumps over 400 points: Why is the stock market rising todayIndian stock markets opened higher on Friday, buoyed by improved global cues and robust domestic investor activity. Experts highlight the role of the US Federal Reserve's rate cut, domestic retail inflows, and stable earnings outlook in supporting the rally.
Sensex opens 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; L&T gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 360.58 points to 85,178.71, while the NSE Nifty50 added 106.90 points to 26,005.45 as of 9:29 am.

entertainment.headline: Kerala High Court gives green signal to Malayalam film Haal after legal row The Kerala High Court has dismissed appeals challenging the reversal of the A-certificate for the Malayalam film Haal. The court reviewed objections about religious portrayal and CBFC-ordered scene removals, ultimately supporting a prior ruling that some certification cuts were not needed.

120 Bahadur, War 2, Sky Force: Why did patriotic films miss the target in 2025? Bollywood's once-reliable war and patriotic genre hit a slump this year with most films failing to hit the mark. Experts blame repetitive storytelling, weak writing, and a lack of emotional tension.

Aditya Dhar reacts to Hrithik Roshan's Dhurandhar praise, calls it very encouraging Aditya Dhar's reaction to Hrithik Roshan's praise for Dhurandhar has drawn attention, especially after the actor shared two contrasting yet appreciative takes on the film. While Hrithik questioned its politics, he applauded its cinematic craft.

Rajinikanth visits Tirupati temple with family after his 75th birthday Superstar Rajinikanth, fresh from celebrating his 75th birthday, paid a visit to Tirumala Tirupati temple with his family to seek divine blessings. A video from the visit on Saturday surfaced online.

Empty theatres, fat pay cheques: Crisis of accountability shakes Tamil industry Kollywood is facing a severe financial crisis in 2025 due to empty theatres and OTT disruption. Theatre owners and producers clash over OTT windows, threatening the industry's future viability.

Exclusive I Saali Mohabbat's Radhika Apte: Not big on morality but ethics Actor Radhika Apte discusses her selective approach to roles, driven by sharp instincts and a search for complexity. Apte, who features in 'Saali Mohabbat', speaks to India Today on drawing the line based on a film's ethical vision, viewing morality as a "society-made thing" that hinders empathy.

BTS' Jungkook's exhibition opens in Mumbai: Fans, chants and ​his Golden era Fans gathered in Bandra as 'Golden: The Moments', BTS and Jungkook's first official activity in India, opens, offering immersive exhibits and a space for community engagement.

Emotional Amitabh Bachchan humbled by sea of fans outside his home Jalsa Actor Amitabh Bachchan shared videos of a "sea of fans" cheering outside his Jalsa residence on Sunday. Moved by their "immeasurable" love, the 83-year-old actor humbly questioned his worthiness, asking what he had done "to be deserving of such" devotion from the massive crowd.

Euphoria Season 3 first footage teases what's in store for Zendaya, Sydney Sweeney The first 'Euphoria Season 3' footage confirms Zendaya's Rue is deep in trouble, in debt to Laurie and running. The show is set for its HBO premiere in April 2026.

EXO to release winter single I'm Home ahead of their 2026 group comeback EXO is making a seasonal comeback with their new single 'I'm Home'. The release hints at a sentimental 2026 album and features six of the original nine members, stirring mixed emotions among fans.

Akshay Kumar joins Dhurandhar meme party, jokes about discovering Akshaye Khanna Akshaye Khanna's performance in the recently released Dhurandhar sparks a renewed wave of appreciation. Now, Akshay Kumar reacted to a meme celebrating Khanna's popularity and performance.

Ram Charan's Peddi kicks off new Hyderabad schedule, to wrap up by January-end Ram Charan's Peddi began a crucial new schedule in Hyderabad, with some emotionally heavy and action-driven scenes slated. The dialogue portions of the film are expected to wrap by the end of January, keeping the unit right on track for the March 2026 theatrical release.

Keerthy Suresh marks anniversary with Goa wedding reel: Core day, core memory Actor Keerthy Suresh and her husband Antony Thattil celebrated their first anniversary on Friday. The couple posted a video that captures memorable moments from their Hindu and Christian wedding ceremonies held in Goa a year ago.

Taylor Swift cries recalling terror attack in The End of an Era documentary series Taylor Swift was seen shedding tears and sharing her anxieties regarding the thwarted Eras Tour terror attack in the premiere episode of 'The End of an Era'. The documentary series is available for streaming on JioHotstar in India.

R Madhavan hits back at Dhurandhar criticism: One wonders if there is an agenda Actor R Madhavan responds to criticism and negative reviews surrounding 'Dhurandhar'. He linked the early negative reviews to a pattern seen in his previous films and raised concerns about the influence of such reviews on public perception.

Richa Chadha on postpartum pain, industry betrayals and returning to work Richa Chadha shared her experiences returning to work after motherhood, addresses professional challenges, and questions the demands of social media on public figures. She welcomed her daughter, Zuneyra, in 2024.

Kate Winslet shares a wild story: When Eminem asked her to shave his butt Kate Winslet revealed on the Graham Norton Show an unusual encounter with Eminem during her first Saturday Night Live appearance, sharing how a surprising request added to her nerves on the show.

Dhurandhar's Ayesha Khan says she was told to 'fix' her nose, teeth for roles Actor Ayesha Khan has spoken about receiving suggestions to undergo cosmetic changes for more opportunities. She recently featured in the song 'Shararat' from 'Dhurandhar' and the film 'Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2'.

Man vs Baby review: Rowan Atkinson's wordless pain saves sugary festive fareRelease Date:Thu Dec 11, 2025 In the Christmas comedy series Man vs Baby, Rowan Atkinson embodies the quiet struggle of Trevor Bingley, a man enduring personal loss and societal disregard, using minimal dialogue to convey deep emotion in an otherwise predictable holiday narrative. Here's our review.

general news.headline: Trump tariffs on India is actually tax on Americans, say US lawmakers as retail prices soarThree House Democrats introduced a resolution to overturn Trump's national emergency tariffs on India, calling the duties illegal and harmful to American workers, consumers, supply chains and US-India relations.

Delhi AQI nears severe as heavy smog reduces visibility, airport issues advisoryDelhi's air quality worsened again on Saturday, with the overall AQI rising to 387 and edging close to the 'severe' category after a brief mid-week improvement. The deterioration was reflected across the city, with 18 areas recording AQI levels above 400, led by Wazirpur, Jahangirpuri and Vivek Vihar as the most polluted hotspots.
Messi in India live: Messi unveils 70-foot statue in Kolkata, meets SRKLionel Messi India tour Day 1 live updates: Messi has unveiled his special 70-foot statue in Kolkata.

Canada truckers' shoot-out caught on video; 3 Indian-origin suspects heldThree Indian-origin truckers were arrested in Brampton, Canada, for their alleged involvement in a tow-truck-related shooting. One suspect is still at large. Both involved groups were reportedly of South Asian descent. Authorities have released a video and a photo of the suspect, urging the public to share information.

120 Bahadur, War 2, Sky Force: Why did patriotic films miss the target in 2025?Bollywood's once-reliable war and patriotic genre hit a slump this year with most films failing to hit the mark. Experts blame repetitive storytelling, weak writing, and a lack of emotional tension.

Video: Impatient Pak PM gatecrashes Putin-Erdogan huddle after 40-minute waitPakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif barged into a room where Russian President Vladimir Putin and Turkey's Recep Tayyip Erdogan were holding a closed-door meeting in Turkmenistan, triggering a field day on social media.

Your daughter hates you: California Governor vs Musk over transgender childCalifornia Governor Gavin Newsom's press office mocked Elon Musk over his estranged transgender daughter, prompting a sharp exchange on X and reigniting their long-running feud over gender policy.

UGC, AICTE, NCTE to go: Bill cleared to bring one higher education regulatorThe Union Cabinet has approved the HECI Bill, now renamed Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhikshan Bill, paving the way for a single higher education regulator to replace the UGC, AICTE, and NCTE. The new body will handle regulation, accreditation, and standards as proposed under NEP 2020, marking a major overhaul of India's higher education system.

Know real Dhurandhars: Men who turned Karachi into a war zoneRehman Dakait, Chaudhry Aslam, Uzair Baloch carved legends in blood, bullets, and vengeance, leaving Pakistan's Lyari haunted. 'Dhurandhar' brings their violent underworld to life on screen, where monsters, messiahs, and spies collide. Know the real stories of these men: the Dhurandhars who ruled Lyari with fear and fire.

Son of Siddaramaiah's aide named in Rs 17.5-crore fraud case, NRI files complaintAn NRI complainant has alleged that the accused issued a cheque to secure property documents, which later bounced due to a forged signature. Police are investigating the allegations.

Are India's Himalayas under threat? Inside Japan's megaquake warningScientists say the answer is far more complex than a simple yes or no. Today, risk can be mapped, and early warnings can save lives.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

Empty theatres, fat pay cheques: Crisis of accountability shakes Tamil industryKollywood is facing a severe financial crisis in 2025 due to empty theatres and OTT disruption. Theatre owners and producers clash over OTT windows, threatening the industry's future viability.

Bangladesh PM frontrunner faces unusual challenge: Father's achievementsTarique Rahman, the frontrunner to be the Bangladesh PM, faces a rival who is using his father Ziaur Rahman's legacy to attack him and his party, the BNP. Abdullah-al-Waki, Tarique's rival in Bogura 6 from the students-led National Citizens Party (NCP), has accused the BNP of straying away from the ideals of Ziaur Rahman.

Akshay Kumar joins Dhurandhar meme party, jokes about discovering Akshaye KhannaAkshaye Khanna's performance in the recently released Dhurandhar sparks a renewed wave of appreciation. Now, Akshay Kumar reacted to a meme celebrating Khanna's popularity and performance.

Why India still loses 9 women every hour to preventable cervical cancerIndia continues to struggle with a heavy cervical cancer burden. The government's new HPV vaccination push is now being positioned as a crucial intervention, one that could finally bend the mortality curve and close long-standing gaps in awareness across states.

Dhurandhar soars, 120 Bahadur flops: A lesson in the psychology of patriotismTwo films, worlds apart in box office fate, highlight India's patriotism divide: audiences crave cathartic dominance over painful remembrance.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

No President can ignore Constitution: 20 US states sue Trump over H-1B visa feeCalifornia and 19 other US states are challenging President Trump's $100,000 fee on new H-1B visas, highlighting concerns over its impact on skilled foreign workers and essential services. The legal battle questions the presidential authority to impose such a surcharge, amid fears of worsening labour shortages.

India's multi alignment: The quiet architecture of a confident republicManaged with foresight, even the India-Russia-USA triangle could evolve into a trikona shakti of stability in global affairs, where dialogue prevails over coercion, realism tempers rivalry, and peace becomes a shared horizon. This idea reflects a simple truth. India is trying to stabilise a world that others have fractured.

From secrecy to spectacle: How India fell in love with IPL auctionThe first IPL auction in 2008 was not televised, yet it has since evolved into one of India's prime-time spectacles. Auctioneer Richard Madley, who held the gavel for 11 seasons, recalls its rise and argues against scrapping the auction, insisting the format ensures fairness and competitive balance.

Stop having coffee after menopause: Study suggests it is linked to bone fractureA decade-long study reveals tea's mild protective effect on bones and risks of excessive coffee in older women. Urban Indians should balance caffeine with calcium and vitamin D to maintain bone health.

Delhi woman, two sons die by suicide at home; note indicates emotional distressA woman and her two sons were found dead in their Kalkaji home in a suicide case after police entered to execute a court order. A handwritten note indicated the family had been struggling with depression.

Counting underway in Kerala local body polls, Left Democratic Front shows early leadVote counting for Kerala's 1,199 local bodies began with a close contest among LDF, UDF and NDA. Early trends show LDF leading in several divisions, setting the tone for 2026 Assembly elections.

sports.headline: Ignored for T20Is, Siraj sends strong message to selectors with SMAT heroics Mohammed Siraj delivered a standout performance, taking 3 wickets for Hyderabad against Mumbai in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025-26. His efforts earned him the Player of the Match award as Hyderabad chased down the target of 132 in just 11.5 overs.

Captain's job is not just to toss: Former opener on Suryakumar Yadav's poor form Former India opener Aakash Chopra has criticised Suryakumar Yadav's poor batting form ahead of T20 World Cup 2026. The India T20I skipper hasn't scored a half century in the last 20 innings.

Kolkata: Anirban Sinha Roy Reports On Lionel Messi's 70-Foot Statue & Fan Frenzy In this Special Report, India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy and Nikhil Naz track the frenzy as Lionel Messi lands in Kolkata for his first visit in 14 years. The Argentine legend kicks off a 72-hour 'Bharat Darshan' by unveiling a 70-foot statue of himself. The programme details his jam-packed schedule, including a match with Telangana CM Revanth Reddy in Hyderabad and a Bollywood exhibition game in Mumbai. Anchor Jessica Goel explores the fan mania, with tickets for a meet-and-greet reportedly costing Rs 10 lakh.

Watch: Lionel Messi's rousing reception at Kolkata airport Argentine superstar Lionel Messi arrived in Kolkata on Saturday to start his GOAT India Tour 2025. The football legend got a rousing reception as thousands of fans swarmed the airport to catch a glimpse of their favourite star.
Messi in India live: Messi unveils 70-foot statue in Kolkata, meets SRK Lionel Messi India tour Day 1 live updates: Messi has unveiled his special 70-foot statue in Kolkata.

Watch: Lionel Messi swarmed by security while Luis Suarez strolls at Kolkata airport Lionel Messi's Kolkata arrival under heavy security highlighted his unmatched global stature. A viral airport clip showing Luis Suarez walking freely offered a light-hearted contrast.

From secrecy to spectacle: How India fell in love with IPL auction The first IPL auction in 2008 was not televised, yet it has since evolved into one of India's prime-time spectacles. Auctioneer Richard Madley, who held the gavel for 11 seasons, recalls its rise and argues against scrapping the auction, insisting the format ensures fairness and competitive balance.

Messi Lands in Kolkata: Global Football Legend's Tour, Security Plans and Fan Tributes This special report covers the anticipated tour of a global football icon. The itinerary includes visits to major cities and interactions with prominent figures. An unidentified speaker details the security protocols, mentioning that '3,000 people will be on this job' to ensure safety. The programme also highlights a fan's tribute featuring a replica house and the excitement surrounding the scheduled matches. The report notes the involvement of various dignitaries and the star's engagement with children.

Messi Lands in India: Argentina Legend's Arrival in Kolkata for 'G.O.A.T Tour' In this Special Report, India Today anchor Jessica Goel and reporter Anirban Sinha Roy track the arrival of football legend Lionel Messi in Kolkata for his 'GOAT India Tour'. The Argentine superstar, accompanied by Luis Suarez and Rodrigo De Paul, landed to a frenzy of fans at the airport. Messi is set to unveil a 72-feet statue of himself and meet Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan (SRK) and former cricketer Sourav Ganguly. The programme captures the excitement of fans who queued up overnight to catch a glimpse of the icon.

Inside Gambhir's Dexter's Lab: No Dee Dee needed when GG pushes all wrong buttons Gautam Gambhir's experiments with the Indian cricket team are slowly resembling that of the protagonist in the famous Dexter's laboratory cartoon. While it was Dee Dee causing chaos in the lab in the cartoon, here it is GG who is pressing all the wrong buttons.

Watch: Ahead of Messi meetup, Shah Rukh Khan arrives in Kolkata Shah Rukh Khan's arrival in Kolkata added Bollywood glamour to Lionel Messi's visit. With both icons set to appear at Salt Lake Stadium, the City of Joy prepared for a rare crossover moment.

Save Indian football: Young fan spotted with placard as Messi arrives in IndiaLionel Messi's India visit brought global attention but little football substance. One placard at a Kolkata airport ended up saying more about Indian football's present crisis than the entire star-studded itinerary.

John Cena's final WWE match at Saturday Night's main event: All you need to knowJohn Cena is all set to bring his iconic WWE career to a close as he will the centre of attraction at WWE's Saturday Night's Main Event on Saturday, December 13. Here's a look at the match card, livestreaming details and more from the event.

Lionel Messi lands in Kolkata to huge fan turnout as GOAT India tour kicks offLionel Messi arrived in Kolkata to launch the GOAT India Tour 2025, drawing huge midnight crowds, ecstatic fans and heavy security as he begins a packed three-day schedule across four Indian cities.

Olympian Antim Panghal dazzles in wrestling nationals, clinches gold medalAntim Panghal secured gold in the women's 55kg category as Haryana topped the team standings on the opening day of the Senior National Wrestling Championship on Friday, December 12.

Four Assam players suspended for alleged corruption in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025The Assam Cricket Association has suspended four players following allegations of involvement in corrupt practices during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025, barring them from all cricket-related activities while investigations continue.

Ashes 2025: Jofra Archer given cheeky gold chain advice by Ex-AUS pacerFormer Australia pacer Ryan Harris took a cheeky dig at Jofra Archer, saying that the England pacer should ditch the big gold chain that he wears while playing to improve his delivery speed.

JioStar and ICC deny break-up rumours, to continue broadcast partnershipThe ICC and JioStar has refuted claims of an imminent breakup in their broadcasting partnership with a joint statement on Friday, December 12.

What's going wrong with Shubman Gill in T20Is? Coach offers a strange explanationIndia vs South Africa: Shubman Gill's prolonged lean patch and India's continued backing of him have placed the spotlight firmly on the young opener as India prepare for next year's T20 World Cup. Gill has averaged less than 25 and hasn't hit a fifty yet in T20Is this year.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi on being Googled more than Virat Kohli: I see it, I move onIndia's 14-year-old sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi has reacted calmly to being Googled more than Virat Kohli after his explosive 171 against UAE in the U19 Asia Cup. The young opener says fame does not distract him as he focuses on preparation and improving his game.

I can see you: Cena gets tribute from Lesnar, Reigns ahead of WWE retirementBrock Lesnar and Roman Reigns sent emotional messages to John Cena ahead of his retirement from WWE. Cena will hang up his boots on December 13 at Saturday Night's main event.

Jharkhand keeper repays Gujarat Titans faith, inspires highest-ever SMAT chaseKumar Kushagra scored an unbeaten 86 to help Jharkhand chase the highest total in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy history against Punjab in Pune on December 12. The 21-year-old wicketkeeper-batter has been retained by Gujarat Titans ahead of the IPL 2026 mini-auction.

Arne Slot to hold talks with Salah, conversation to determine future with LiverpoolLiverpool coach Arne Slot says he is in talks with Mohamed Salah after the forward's explosive outburst raised fresh doubts over his future at Anfield. Salah, frustrated by being dropped and left out of key games, claimed the club had thrown him "under the bus" as tensions between player and manager continue to rise.

If Samson opens again, can't expect him to perform: Irfan Pathan gives reality-checkIND vs SA: Irfan Pathan has raised concerns about India's top-order stability, warning that Shubman Gill's prolonged slump is putting pressure on both the player and the team management. He also highlighted captain Suryakumar Yadav's ongoing struggles and the uncertainty surrounding a possible return for Sanju Samson.

43, retired but new captain: Anderson dons new role with LancashireJames Anderson has been appointed as Lancashire's County Championship captain ahead of the new season. Anderson aims for promotion back to Division One after a challenging 2025 season.

Renewed hunger for white-ball, but Quinton de Kock rules out Test returnQuinton de Kock said that he has found renewed hunger to play white-ball cricket for South Africa but ruled out a return to Tests. De Kock made his return to play for South Africa in ODIs and T20Is in 2025.

David Warner backs Usman Khawaja to replace Travis Head as opener in AdelaideDavid Warner has publicly supported Usman Khawaja's return to the opening slot for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide, urging selectors to keep Travis Head at No. 5 and maintain stability in the Australian batting order.

Want to shake hands with Lionel Messi? You can if you pay Rs 10 lakhLionel Messi's GOAT Tour has sparked excitement, but the Rs 10 lakh price tag for a handshake has stunned fans. The Meet and Greet is shaping up to be the most exclusive experience of his India visit.

IPL in Bengaluru? Chinnaswamy Stadium gets government go-ahead to host matches againBengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium edges closer to normal duty as Karnataka clears matches in principle, but play can resume only after major safety upgrades recommended by the D'Cunha Commission are fully implemented.

Why is Shubman Gill vice-captain? Ex-batter says pained by Sanju Samson T20I snubIndia vs South Africa: Former India batter Subramaniam Badrinath said he has been pained to see Sanju Samson warming the bench in T20Is despite scoring three hundreds in the last 12 months. He also questioned the team management's continued backing of Shubman Gill.

Nitish Kumar Reddy takes hattrick in SMAT, RCB captain one of his victimsNitish Kumar Reddy stole the spotlight with a brilliant hat-trick that included Rajat Patidar's wicket. Andhra still fell short, but his triple strike remained the defining moment of the SMAT clash.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
